[Learn more](https://policies.google.com/technologies/cookies) Ok, Got it `ngSkipHydration` is a special attribute which indicates to Angular that a particular component should be opted-out of [hydration](https://angular.dev/extended-diagnostics/guide/hydration). This diagnostic ensures that this attribute `ngSkipHydration` is set statically and the value is either set to `"true"` or an empty value. ``` import {Component} from '@angular/core';@Component({ template: ``,})class MyComponent { hasUser = true;} ``` check ## [What's wrong with that?](https://angular.dev/extended-diagnostics/NG8108\#whats-wrong-with-that) As a special attribute implemented by Angular, `ngSkipHydration` needs to be statically analyzable so Angular knows at compile-time whether or not hydration is needed for a component. ## [What should I do instead?](https://angular.dev/extended-diagnostics/NG8108\#what-should-i-do-instead) When using the `ngSkipHydration`, ensure that it's set as a static attribute (i.e. you do not use the Angular template binding syntax). ``` import {Component} from '@angular/core';@Component({ template: ` `,})class MyComponent {} ``` check If a conditional is necessary, you can wrap the component in an `*ngIf`. ``` import {Component} from '@angular/core';@Component({ template: `
`,})class MyComponent {} ``` check ## [Configuration requirements](https://angular.dev/extended-diagnostics/NG8108\#configuration-requirements) [`strictTemplates`](https://angular.dev/extended-diagnostics/tools/cli/template-typecheck#strict-mode) must be enabled for any extended diagnostic to emit. `skipHydrationNotStatic` has no additional requirements beyond `strictTemplates`. ## [What if I can't avoid this?](https://angular.dev/extended-diagnostics/NG8108\#what-if-i-cant-avoid-this) This diagnostic can be disabled by editing the project's `tsconfig.json` file: ``` { "angularCompilerOptions": { "extendedDiagnostics": { "checks": { "skipHydrationNotStatic": "suppress" } } }} ``` check See [extended diagnostic configuration](https://angular.dev/extended-diagnostics/extended-diagnostics#configuration) for more info.
